venue.address_2: cross street is Washington Street in Dudley Station
venue.name: Haley House Cafe

item.description:
The Color of Film Collaborative in partnership with the Haley House periodically present documentaries and narrative films via Dinner and a Movie. The next offering is scheduled for Friday March 23, 2012. Let's get together and enjoy each other's company.

Dinner will be served at 6:30 PM. It will be prepared by Kevin London, chef/owner at the Farmhouse Restaurant at the Top of the World resort at Lake George, NY, with help from
the staff of the Haley House Bakery Cafe staff. The menu consists of Misty Knoll Chicken, served two ways, accompanied by Roasted Root Vegetables. Vegan alternative will feature Roasted Root Vegetables with Local Greens. A selection of Haley House Bakery Café Dessert Bars will complete the meal.

Beer, wine and non-alcoholic beverages are available for purchase.

The film, THUNDER SOUL which is presented by Jamie Foxx, screens at 7:30 PM. It documents the extraordinary alumni of Houston's storied Kashmere High School Stage Band, who return home after 35 years to play a tribute concert for the 92-year-old "Prof," their beloved band leader who broke the color barrier and transformed the school's struggling jazz band into a world-class funk powerhouse in the early 1970s. Truly inspirational. 

Purchase tickets for $26.87 (includes dinner and movie but not beverages) at http://www.brownpapertickets.com/event/234058

***A portion of the evenings proceeds will be donated to a local youth music program.

Public Transit:

Check out MBTA or Hop Stop to create your route by public transit.
Orange Line subway to Ruggles Station then any bus to Dudley Station

Driving Directions:

Check out Google to arrange your driving directions

Parking:

Parking lot on Dade Street as well as along Washington Street.

 

 

Would also like you to know the Roxbury International Film Festival (RIFF) showcases and honors the work of emerging and established filmmakers of color as well as films important to our community. It has become the largest festival in New England dedicated to celebrating this genre. This is always a great time with fascinating people. Run time is Thursday June 14th through Sunday June 17th.
item.how_to_find_us: You can find us by texting or calling me (617) 445-7549

group.name: Breakfast, Brunch, Lunch, & Dinner Meetup Group

item.name: Dinner and A Movie on Friday March 23rd
